Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Phew, we managed to break through it...

Name: Queensway
Phrase: They aren't very strong enemies, but it's harder than I thought, fighting Mist Monsters in a place like this. It's different from fighting them in a cave or on a mountain path.

Name: Queensway
Phrase: Getting the alarm sounded, blocked, and chased by them makes me feel like I'm the villain.

Name: Putra
Phrase: Well, we're villains to the people who protect these ruins, right? They called us intruders and everything.

Name: Amiens
Phrase: Désolé, it's because we got the code wrong...

Name: Putra
Phrase: Don't worry about it. We've made progress because of that.
Putra is right. Amiens and Rouen deciphered the code, which opened a new door. Although we had to fight the enemy, it was thanks to them that we were able to move on.
The problem is that there are so many paths to choose that it is difficult to know which way to go.
Such divergences are a part of exploring ruins, but when the underground passageway is so narrow and foggy, it's impossible to just keep going where we want as usual.

Name: Paddington
Phrase: This is exactly the kind of situation where I'll be useful!

Name: Paddington
Phrase: Conductor, don't worry! No matter how intricate these ruins are, I can memorise them perfectly! Let's make a map and go over all the routes!

Name: Rouen
Phrase: I'm afraid I'll have to reject your approach.

Name: Paddington
Phrase: W-Why not? I can remember everything I see with my own eyes perfectly well, you know?

Name: Rouen
Phrase: There is no guarantee that these ruins will remain unchanged, Paddington, even if you remember the paths, they could be gone by the time we return. That's the way it is with sites having booby-traps.

Name: Rouen
Phrase: And what happens if Paddington becomes incapacitated? What if the map you made suddenly burned up, or the lights stop working?

Name: Queensway
Phrase: If that happens, there's nothing we can do. That's if it does happen.

Name: Amiens
Phrase: It can happen. Be it inside ancient ruins, or inside Phantom Mist.

Name: Queensway
Phrase: Oh, I see...

Name: Amiens
Phrase: Objects with unknown powers can cause phenomena beyond our imagination. I think the Phantom Mist is a typical example of this, but in fact ancient ruins also have such properties.

Name: Rouen
Phrase: If our lifeline disappears at the end of the maze, the whole troop will be destroyed, right? You have to understand the structure and properties of a ruins first.

Name: Amiens
Phrase: Walking around is not a good strategy when it comes to exploring ruins. I used to explore in a very literal way back then and made a lot of mistakes.

Name: Paddington
Phrase: Hawawa, now that you mention it, you're right. I was hoping I could be of some help too...

Name: Rouen
Phrase: Don't worry, Paddington's rote memorization ability will come in handy in the future. The ability to remember is essential to conquering the ruins.

Name: Paddington
Phrase: T-that's very kind of you to say! If there is anything I can do, please let me know!

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: These two have become a lot more reliable in the little time I've seen them...

Name: Putra
Phrase: Oho, the gendarmerie's veteran looks a bit impressed.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: I thought she hadn't changed when she jumped out of the tree, but of course it's impossible they haven't changed at all. Even those two were chosen for the SSS for very good reasons.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: The battle earlier was brilliant, and they've properly considered the entire unit's movements. I can't be outdone either.

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: Hey, can you take a look at this? There's something strange over here.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Something strange?

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: This is!

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: It's a steel minecart. From its structure, I think it's designed to have one person ride on and operate.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: It's Yoshino who found it you know? Yoshino found it, it's Yoshino who found it!

Name: Putra
Phrase: It's nothing like the minecarts you see in Flamarinian mines. Is the groove underneath the rail? It's nothing like the rails on the Mist Train.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: How do you move this thing?

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: I had Yoshino take a look at it, but she has no idea either. But these mysterious rails seem to extend all the way to the end of the tunnel. I think they are installed in the main tunnels.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: So we should explore the tunnels that these rails go through. If there is a path for the minecart, there might be some important facilities behind it.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: There's more there's more! Yoshino has made another important discovery!

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Yes, yes, we're listening.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: Everyone, please take a look at this.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Are these bars? There's what looks like an opening/closing device on the inside, but we can't reach it from our side. I wonder if we have to go inside to open it.

Name: Putra
Phrase: It looks like it goes all the way to the back...

Name: Putra
Phrase: Hey, there's light leaking from the other side!

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: Yes. Behind these bars there's a connection to the outside. There's probably a tochka or an exit to the ground.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: By the way, Yoshino found this too.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Wow, Yoshino, you did a great job.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: Mufufu, you can give even more praises if you like. You can even pat the tail and give sweets, can't you?

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Alright, I'll stroke your tail then♪

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: Oooooh, Vivienne, you are quite the technician~

Name: Rouen
Phrase: Places where we require keys are the places to go.

Name: Amiens
Phrase: The priority of this investigation is quite high, yes.

Name: Amiens
Phrase: I saw that there are some important facilities beyond these bars. It seems to be a minecart depot, and I think it is essential to conquer it in order to proceed.

Name: Putra
Phrase: I agree with that opinion, but how do we unlock it even? Do we go back to the starting point and try to enter again from the outside? Well, only if we can get in from above ground.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Amiens and Rouen, what do you think?

Name: Amiens
Phrase: I think there is a way to unlock these bars.

Name: Rouen
Phrase: I think I agree with Amiens. Every trap that prevents intruders has a way to be dismantled. The people who created the trap has to be able to proceed themselves.

Name: Putra
Phrase: Do we have to solve another riddle like before?

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: But there's no code on these bars that could give us a clue. Is there any way to get inside?

Name: Rouen
Phrase: In theory, there should be alternate pathways in the floor or ceiling behind these things. Let's look carefully for any suspicious doors or switches.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: The floor along the wall looks like it could be a drain. Speaking of suspicious places, here's one...

Name: Paddington
Phrase: Everyone, one of these drains has a different quantity of meshes than the others!

Name: Putra
Phrase: Quantity of meshes!? What...? The quantity of meshes!?

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: Traps like these are too detailed to be understood.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: How did you even find out all those details in the dark?

Name: Paddington
Phrase: The pattern looked different from the others, so I did a bit of counting to try it out. When I looked closer, I saw that the quanity and pattern of the meshes were slightly different!

Name: Paddington
Phrase: Miss Vivienne, please give me a pat, too!

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Oh, sure, if... Paddington is happy with that...

Name: Paddington
Phrase: Thank you very much!

Name: Amiens
Phrase: This drainage outlet leads underground. It's really narrow, but a small person could just barely get through if they crouched down. If we can open the bars from the other side, we can all proceed to the end of the passage.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: Then, firstly a small person has to go through the drain like a rat.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Oui, that's right Yoshino.

Name: Putra
Phrase: Mhm, that's right Yoshino.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: The question is who should be going. Shashou, how many people would you like to dispatch?
Let me think. It's better to have as small a group as possible, so maybe one or two people. Preferably two, in case something goes wrong.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: You heard that, Yakutsk? Good luck, do it for everyone.

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: I don't have a choice. I'll go with you because I'm worried about you alone.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: Does that mean, Yoshino has to go too?

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Mhmhm, bien sûr?

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: B-But, Yoshino's tail and ears might get stuck.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Don't worry. If you get dirty, I'll groom you again then♪ Don't worry, just shove yourself in there.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: Ooooh-, Vivienne is more Spankin than usual today...

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: I think you meant Spartan.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: Ooooh-, that's right.

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: Come on, be prepared to go in, Yoshino will take the lead.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: Why? Yakutsk not taking the lead? Are you afraid that it might be haunted?

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: Idiot, of course not! Yer in the lead because your big ears and tail might get stuck! I'm not going to argue with ya! Now get your ass in the hole! Move on!

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: Ooooh-, Yakky-tan is also Spartan...
